SENT.plain: CADASIL is an autosomal dominant non-atherosclerotic vasculopathy that frequently presents as recurrent subcortical strokes, or vascular dementia in middle age
Some patients may have prominent mental symptoms or migraine
Widespread white matter demyelination and subcortical lacunar infarcts are demonstrated by magnetic resonance imaging
Demonstration of granular osmophilic material in arteries in skin biopsies is a useful diagnostic tool
CADASIL has been linked to mutation in the Notch 3 gene locus on chromosome 19
Genetic testing is available for clinical diagnosis
